alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:41AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Henderson, central Hancock, southern Henry, southern Des Moines, Van Buren, Lee, Clark and eastern Scotland Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 940 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hillsboro to Wyaconda. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hillsboro around 945 AM CDT. Salem around 955 AM CDT. Kahoka, St. Paul and Pilot Grove around 1000 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wayland, Lowell, St. Francisville, Danville, Alexandria, Keokuk, Warsaw, Middletown, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant, Burlington, West Burlington, Hamilton and Gulf Port. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri.
